title: Yang-Mills Existence and Mass Gap
description: One of the seven Millennium Prize Problems. Prove that quantum Yang-Mills theory exists and has a positive mass gap.

overview.historicalContext: Yang-Mills theory (1954) underlies the Standard Model of particle physics. The Millennium problem asks to prove rigorous existence of quantum Yang-Mills theory with a positive mass gap.
overview.problemStatement: **Problem (Clay Mathematics Institute):** Prove that for any compact simple gauge group G, a non-trivial quantum Yang-Mills theory exists on R^4 and has a mass gap Delta > 0.
overview.proofStrategy:
This file provides:
1. Classical Yang-Mills infrastructure (Lie algebras, gauge groups)
2. Definition of the Yang-Mills action
3. Statement of the mass gap problem
4. Proof that Maxwell theory is U(1) Yang-Mills
keyInsights: Yang-Mills is the mathematical foundation of QCD
The mass gap explains why the strong force is short-range
Full formalization requires rigorous QFT (not yet established)

conclusion.summary: The Yang-Mills Millennium Problem remains open. This formalization provides classical infrastructure and the problem statement.
conclusion.implications: Resolution would put quantum chromodynamics on rigorous mathematical foundations, explaining quark confinement.
openQuestions: Can QFT be made mathematically rigorous?
What is the correct axiom system for quantum Yang-Mills?
